◆ dsa_set_several_iso_registers_a()

int dsa_set_several_iso_registers_a ( DSA_DEVICE_BASE *  grp,
int  typ1,
unsigned  idx1,
int  sidx1,
double  val1,
int  conv1,
int  typ2,
unsigned  idx2,
int  sidx2,
double  val2,
int  conv2,
int  typ3,
unsigned  idx3,
int  sidx3,
double  val3,
int  conv3,
int  typ4,
unsigned  idx4,
int  sidx4,
double  val4,
int  conv4,
int  typ5,
unsigned  idx5,
int  sidx5,
double  val5,
int  conv5,
int  typ6,
unsigned  idx6,
int  sidx6,
double  val6,
int  conv6,
DSA_HANDLER  handler,
void *  param 
)

Set several registers ISO value in one shot (Command:SSR) - asynchronous.

Parameters
grpa pointer to the group structure
typ1the type of first register to set
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx1the index number of the first register to set
sidx1the depth of the first register to set
val1the value of the first register to set in ISO
conv1the ISO conversion value of the first register to set
typ2the type of second register to set (If 0, the function will set only 2 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx2the index number of the second register to set
sidx2the depth of the second register to set
val2the value of the second register to set in ISO
conv2the ISO conversion value of the second register to set
typ3the type of third register to set (If 0, the function will set only 2 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx3the index number of the third register to set
sidx3the depth of the third register to set
val3the value of the third register to set in ISO
conv3the ISO conversion value of the third register to set
typ4the type of fourth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 3 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx4the index number of the fourth register to set
sidx4the depth of the fourth register to set
val4the value of the fourth register to set in ISO
conv4the ISO conversion value of the fourth register to set
typ5the type of fifth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 4 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx5the index number of the fifth register to set
sidx5the depth of the fifth register to set
val5the value of the fifth register to set in ISO
conv5the ISO conversion value of the fifth register to set
typ6the type of sixth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 5 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx6the index number of the sixth register to set
sidx6the depth of the sixth register to set
val6the value of the sixth register to set in ISO
conv6the ISO conversion value of the sixth register to set
handlerthe handler function called when the function is executed
paramuser parameter transmitted to the handler function
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
DSA_EACQDEVINUSE One of the device is already doing an acquisition
DSA_EACQNOTPOSSIBLE Drives must be connected with transnet
DSA_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
DSA_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
DSA_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
DSA_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
DSA_EBADIPOLGRP bad ipol group
DSA_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found

DSA_EBADSTATE bad state
DSA_EBUSERROR bus in error state
DSA_EBUSRESET bus in reset state
DSA_ECANCEL transaction canceled

DSA_ECONVERT conversion error
DSA_EDRVERROR drive in error
DSA_EDRVFAILED drive failed
DSA_EEQUATION Equation cannot be resolved
DSA_EFLUSH Flush communication timeout
DSA_EINTERNAL internal error
DSA_EMAPNOTACTIVATED Mapping cannot be activated by the device
DSA_EMETAHEADER bad metadata header
DSA_EMETAHEADERVER bad metadata header version
DSA_EMETAPARSER Metadata parsing error
DSA_ENOACK no acknowledge
DSA_ENODRIVE no drive response
DSA_ENOFREESLOT no free slot available
DSA_ENOFWINPOOL Firmware not found in FW pool
DSA_ENOLIBRARY external library not found
DSA_ENOTIMPLEMENTED not implemented
DSA_EOBSOLETE function is obsolete
DSA_EOPENPORT open com error

DSA_ERTVWRITESYNCRO RTV write syncronisation error

double  val5,
int  conv5,
int  typ6,
unsigned  idx6,

double  val6,
int  conv6,

Set several registers ISO value in one shot (Command:SSR) - synchronous.

Parameters
grpa pointer to the group structure
typ1the type of first register to set
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)

  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)

sidx1the depth of the first register to set
val1the value of the first register to set in ISO
conv1the ISO conversion value of the first register to set
typ2the type of second register to set (If 0, the function will set only 1 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx2the index number of the second register to set
sidx2the depth of the second register to set
val2the value of the second register to set in ISO
conv2the ISO conversion value of the second register to set
typ3the type of third register to set (If 0, the function will set only 2 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx3the index number of the third register to set
sidx3the depth of the third register to set
val3the value of the third register to set in ISO
conv3the ISO conversion value of the third register to set
typ4the type of fourth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 3 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx4the index number of the fourth register to set
sidx4the depth of the fourth register to set
val4the value of the fourth register to set in ISO
conv4the ISO conversion value of the fourth register to set
typ5the type of fifth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 4 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx5the index number of the fifth register to set
sidx5the depth of the fifth register to set
val5the value of the fifth register to set in ISO
conv5the ISO conversion value of the fifth register to set
typ6the type of sixth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 5 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx6the index number of the sixth register to set
sidx6the depth of the sixth register to set
val6the value of the sixth register to set in ISO
conv6the ISO conversion value of the sixth register to set
timeoutthe timeout value in ms or
  • DSA_DEF_TIMEOUT a value depending of the used communication bus (generally 1 or 2 seconds)
  • INFINITE infinite timeout
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
DSA_EACQDEVINUSE One of the device is already doing an acquisition
DSA_EACQNOTPOSSIBLE Drives must be connected with transnet
DSA_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
DSA_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
DSA_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
DSA_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
DSA_EBADIPOLGRP bad ipol group
DSA_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
DSA_EBADPARAM bad parameter
DSA_EBADSEQVERSION Version syntax error (Syntax: [n]n.nnc)
DSA_EBADSTATE bad state
DSA_EBUSERROR bus in error state
DSA_EBUSRESET bus in reset state
DSA_ECANCEL transaction canceled
DSA_ECFGCOMPFILE File compiled for different axes configuration
DSA_ECONVERT conversion error
DSA_EDRVERROR drive in error
DSA_EDRVFAILED drive failed
DSA_EEQUATION Equation cannot be resolved
DSA_EFLUSH Flush communication timeout
DSA_EINTERNAL internal error
DSA_EMAPNOTACTIVATED Mapping cannot be activated by the device
DSA_EMETAHEADER bad metadata header
DSA_EMETAHEADERVER bad metadata header version
DSA_EMETAPARSER Metadata parsing error
DSA_ENOACK no acknowledge
DSA_ENODRIVE no drive response
DSA_ENOFREESLOT no free slot available
DSA_ENOFWINPOOL Firmware not found in FW pool
DSA_ENOLIBRARY external library not found
DSA_ENOTIMPLEMENTED not implemented
DSA_EOBSOLETE function is obsolete
DSA_EOPENPORT open com error
DSA_ERTVREADSYNCRO RTV read synchronization error
DSA_ERTVWRITESYNCRO RTV write syncronisation error
DSA_ESYNTAX Mapping file syntax error
DSA_ESYSTEM system error
DSA_ETIMEOUT timeout error
DSA_ETRANS transaction error
DSA_ETRANSNET Transnet is not established in imparted time
DSA_EUNZIP Unable to unzip metadata buffer
DSA_EUPLOADFILE MD5 of uploaded file does not fit MD5 of original
DSA_EWFP Communication not opened(device in WaitForProgram)

DSA_HANDLER  handler,
void *  param 
)

Set several registers increment value in one shot (Command:SSR) - asynchronous.

Parameters
grpa pointer to the group structure
typ1the type of first register to set
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx1the index number of the first register to set
sidx1the depth of the first register to set
val1the value of the first register to set in increment
typ2the type of second register to set (If 0, the function will set only 1 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx2the index number of the second register to set
sidx2the depth of the second register to set
val2the value of the second register to set in increment
typ3the type of third register to set(If 0, the function will set only 2 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx3the index number of the third register to set
sidx3the depth of the third register to set
val3the value of the third register to set in increment
typ4the type of fourth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 3 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx4the index number of the fourth register to set
sidx4the depth of the fourth register to set
val4the value of the fourth register to set in increment
typ5the type of fifth register to set (If 0, the function will set only 4 register)
  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)

sidx5the depth of the fifth register to set
val5the value of the fifth register to set in increment

  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT32 32 bits integer ESM parameter (W)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_INT64 64 bits integer ESM parameter (WL)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT32 32 bits float ESM parameter (WF)
  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)
idx6the index number of the sixth register to set
sidx6the depth of the sixth register to set
val6the value of the sixth register to set in increment
handlerthe handler function called when the function is executed
paramuser parameter transmitted to the handler function
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured

  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)

  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)

val1the value of the first register to set in increment

  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT64 64 bits float user registers (XD)
  • DMD_TYP_LKT_FLOAT64 64 bits float movement lookup tables (LD)
  • DMD_TYP_TRIGGER_INT64 64 bits integer triggers buffer (EL)

  • DMD_TYP_ESM_FLOAT64 64 bits float ESM parameter (WD)

  • DMD_TYP_USER 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT32 32 bits integer user registers (X)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_INT64 64 bits integer user registers (XL)
  • DMD_TYP_USER_FLOAT32 32 bits float user registers (XF)

◆ dsa_start_download_register_s()

int dsa_start_download_register_s ( DSA_DEVICE_BASE *  grp,
int  typ,
int  start_idx,
int  end_idx,
int  sidx,
long  timeout 
)

Start a download of a set of parameters - synchronous.

This function will start a download of registers datas. To really download the registers datas, several call to dsa_download_data_s must be done until all the datas are downloaded. Once all registers's datas have been downloaded, it is recommended to terminate the download by a call to dsa_download_data_s with size = 0. This will properly terminate the download data process.
IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START SEVERAL KIND OF DOWNLOAD TOGETHER AND IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START AN UPLOAD WITH A DOWNLOAD TOGETHER !!!

Parameters
grpthe device-group or device pointer
typthe typ of the register to download
start_idxthe first register-index to download
end_idxthe last register-index to download
sidxthe register-depth to download
timeoutthe timeout value in ms or
  • DSA_DEF_TIMEOUT It is not recommended to use this value with this function
  • INFINITE infinite timeout
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
DSA_EACQDEVINUSE One of the device is already doing an acquisition
DSA_EACQNOTPOSSIBLE Drives must be connected with transnet
DSA_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
DSA_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
DSA_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
DSA_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
DSA_EBADIPOLGRP bad ipol group
DSA_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
DSA_EBADPARAM bad parameter
DSA_EBADSEQVERSION Version syntax error (Syntax: [n]n.nnc)
DSA_EBADSTATE bad state
DSA_EBUSERROR bus in error state
DSA_EBUSRESET bus in reset state
DSA_ECANCEL transaction canceled
DSA_ECFGCOMPFILE File compiled for different axes configuration
DSA_ECONVERT conversion error
DSA_EDRVERROR drive in error
DSA_EDRVFAILED drive failed
DSA_EEQUATION Equation cannot be resolved
DSA_EFLUSH Flush communication timeout
DSA_EINTERNAL internal error
DSA_EMAPNOTACTIVATED Mapping cannot be activated by the device
DSA_EMETAHEADER bad metadata header
DSA_EMETAHEADERVER bad metadata header version
DSA_EMETAPARSER Metadata parsing error
DSA_ENOACK no acknowledge
DSA_ENODRIVE no drive response
DSA_ENOFREESLOT no free slot available
DSA_ENOFWINPOOL Firmware not found in FW pool
DSA_ENOLIBRARY external library not found
DSA_ENOTIMPLEMENTED not implemented
DSA_EOBSOLETE function is obsolete
DSA_EOPENPORT open com error
DSA_ERTVREADSYNCRO RTV read synchronization error
DSA_ERTVWRITESYNCRO RTV write syncronisation error
DSA_ESYNTAX Mapping file syntax error
DSA_ESYSTEM system error
DSA_ETIMEOUT timeout error
DSA_ETRANS transaction error
DSA_ETRANSNET Transnet is not established in imparted time
DSA_EUNZIP Unable to unzip metadata buffer
DSA_EUPLOADFILE MD5 of uploaded file does not fit MD5 of original
DSA_EWFP Communication not opened(device in WaitForProgram)

◆ dsa_start_upload_metadata_s()

int dsa_start_upload_metadata_s ( DSA_DEVICE *  dev,
dword  kind,
long  timeout 
)

Start a upload metadata (Command:SUMETA) - synchronous.

This function will start an upload of metadata values. To really upload the metadata, several call to dsa_upload_data_s must be done. When dsa_upload_data_s return 0 bytes, this means that the selected metadata has been completely uploaded. It is recommended to call this function until 0 byte is returned. This will properly terminate the upload data process.
IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START SEVERAL KIND OF DOWNLOAD TOGETHER AND IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START AN UPLOAD WITH A DOWNLOAD TOGETHER !!!

Parameters
devthe device pointer
kindthe kind of metadata to upload. An ored value of the following flags
  • DSA_START_UPLOAD_METADATA_HEADER Upload the header of metadata
  • DSA_START_UPLOAD_METADATA_STATIC Upload the static metadata
  • DSA_START_UPLOAD_METADATA_DYNAMIC Upload the dynamic metadata
timeoutthe timeout value in ms or
  • DSA_DEF_TIMEOUT It is not recommended to use this value with this function
  • INFINITE infinite timeout
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured
DSA_EACQDEVINUSE One of the device is already doing an acquisition
DSA_EACQNOTPOSSIBLE Drives must be connected with transnet
DSA_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
DSA_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
DSA_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
DSA_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
DSA_EBADIPOLGRP bad ipol group
DSA_EBADLIBRARY function of external library not found
DSA_EBADPARAM bad parameter
DSA_EBADSEQVERSION Version syntax error (Syntax: [n]n.nnc)
DSA_EBADSTATE bad state
DSA_EBUSERROR bus in error state
DSA_EBUSRESET bus in reset state
DSA_ECANCEL transaction canceled
DSA_ECFGCOMPFILE File compiled for different axes configuration
DSA_ECONVERT conversion error
DSA_EDRVERROR drive in error
DSA_EDRVFAILED drive failed
DSA_EEQUATION Equation cannot be resolved
DSA_EFLUSH Flush communication timeout
DSA_EINTERNAL internal error
DSA_EMAPNOTACTIVATED Mapping cannot be activated by the device

DSA_EMETAHEADERVER bad metadata header version
DSA_EMETAPARSER Metadata parsing error
DSA_ENOACK no acknowledge
DSA_ENODRIVE no drive response
DSA_ENOFREESLOT no free slot available
DSA_ENOFWINPOOL Firmware not found in FW pool
DSA_ENOLIBRARY external library not found
DSA_ENOTIMPLEMENTED not implemented
DSA_EOBSOLETE function is obsolete
DSA_EOPENPORT open com error
DSA_ERTVREADSYNCRO RTV read synchronization error
DSA_ERTVWRITESYNCRO RTV write syncronisation error

◆ dsa_start_upload_register_s()

int dsa_start_upload_register_s ( DSA_DEVICE *  dev,
int  typ,
int  start_idx,
int  end_idx,
int  sidx,
long  timeout 
)

Start a upload a register set (Command:SUP) - synchronous.

This function will start an upload of registers values. To really upload the registers datas, several call to dsa_upload_data_s must be done. When dsa_upload_data_s return 0 bytes, this means that the selected registers has been completely uploaded. It is recommended to call this function until 0 byte is returned. This will properly terminate the upload data process.
IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START SEVERAL KIND OF DOWNLOAD TOGETHER AND IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START AN UPLOAD WITH A DOWNLOAD TOGETHER !!!

Parameters
devthe device pointer
typthe typ of the register to download
start_idxthe first register-index to upload (included)
end_idxthe last register-index to upload (included)
sidxthe register-depth to upload
timeoutthe timeout value in ms or
  • DSA_DEF_TIMEOUT It is not recommended to use this value with this function
  • INFINITE infinite timeout
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured

◆ dsa_upload_data_s()

int dsa_upload_data_s ( DSA_DEVICE *  dev,
void *  data,
size_t  size,
int  timeout 
)

Upload a data chunk.

Uploaded data will correspond to data type specified by dsa_start_upload... function (Command:UDS)- synchronous. Try to upload "size" byte of data specified by call to one of the dsa_start_upload... function. The function will return the real number of uploaded bytes. this real number will be a multiple of asked data type. If no data are available, the function will return 0. It is recommended to call this function until 0 byte is returned. This will properly terminate the upload data process.
IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START SEVERAL KIND OF DOWNLOAD TOGETHER AND IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO START AN UPLOAD WITH A DOWNLOAD TOGETHER !!!

Parameters
devthe single device pointer
datathe data buffer
sizethe size of the data buffer in byte
timeoutthe timeout value in ms or
  • DSA_DEF_TIMEOUT It is not recommended to use this value with this function
  • INFINITE infinite timeout
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured or number of really uploaded data in byte
DSA_EACQDEVINUSE One of the device is already doing an acquisition
DSA_EACQNOTPOSSIBLE Drives must be connected with transnet
DSA_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered
DSA_EBADCOMPRESSTOOL Unhandled compress tool
DSA_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
DSA_EBADDRVVER bad drive version
DSA_EBADIPOLGRP bad ipol group

DSA_EBADSTATE bad state

◆ dsa_upload_file_s()

int dsa_upload_file_s ( DSA_DEVICE *  dev,
const char *  src_file_name,
const char *  dest_file_name,
int  block_type,
dword  flag,
long  timeout,
DSA_PROGRESS  progress_fct,
void *  puser 
)

Upload a file from the target (Command:GFS+SUSF).

Available on UltimET Advanced or MISCON ONLY.

Parameters
devthe UltimET Advanced master or the MISCON from which the file must be uploaded
src_file_namethe name of the source file on the target. The file name cannot be more than 32 characters length.
dest_file_namethe name of the file which will be created on the host.
block_typethe block type. Each file is associated to a type. The type tells the target where to find the file.
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_BOOT
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_FIRMWARE
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_UPDATE_PACKAGE
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_C_PARAMETER
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_X_PARAMETER
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_LOOKUP
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_SEQUENCE
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_KE_PARAMETER
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_MAPPING
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_EXTENSION_1
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_EXTENSION_2
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_RESERVED
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_EXTENSION_RESERVED
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_SIGNATURE
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_METADATA
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_IMAGE
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_EDI
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_CSM
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_EXTRA
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_FLASH
  • DMD_FW_BLOCK_XML_PARAMETER
flagnot used
progress_fctthe the user function which will be called informing the progress of the function
pusera user parameter return as is to progress_fct
timeoutthe timeout value in ms or
  • DSA_DEF_TIMEOUT It is not recommended to use this value with this function
  • INFINITE infinite timeout
Returns
a negative value if an error or a timeout has occured or number of really uploaded data in byte
DSA_EACQDEVINUSE One of the device is already doing an acquisition
DSA_EACQNOTPOSSIBLE Drives must be connected with transnet
DSA_EAXESRECOVER Transnet established but axes not recovered

DSA_EBADDRIVER bad device driver installed
